meanings.definition: To place in a particular position.
meanings.sent1: She is putting the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy putting fresh flowers in a vase.
meanings.sent3: Putting the puzzle pieces together was challenging.
meanings.sent4: He is putting all his effort into his work.
meanings.sent5: The teacher is putting the students in groups for the project.

meanings.definition: The action of hitting a golf ball into a hole.
meanings.sent1: His putting technique improved after practice.
meanings.sent2: The golfer's putting skills helped him win the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat's putting of the ball into the hole was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her putting on the golf course was precise and skillful.
meanings.sent5: Watching the professional's putting was inspiring.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to be in a particular state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The putting of the room in order took hours.
meanings.sent2: His putting of the plan into action was successful.
meanings.sent3: The putting of the cake in the oven made the kitchen smell delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her putting of the flowers in water kept them fresh.
meanings.sent5: The putting of effort into the project paid off in the end.
